title: _act_
author: _act_
content: Anytime I open Sparrow wallet, I will enter the password. After I enter the password, the next is that I will have to enter my BIP39 passphrase. It will state it like this:Code:Enter the BIP39 passphrase for keystore: BIP39Under it is the master fingerprint. I think I did something wrong while importing my seed phrase. Is there anything I can do that Sparrow will not ask me to enter the passphrase anytime I just open the wallet. I prefer only the password.Or probably I will have no other option than to reimport the seed phrase and the passphrase.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Are you using the latest version of Sparrow wallet? It was reported as a bug and appears to have been resolved here https://github.com/sparrowwallet/sparrow/commit/902243839749d1693eb93b3a1161f41d37d354a0Upgrade to 1.8.0 and your problem will be solved.Discussion about this topic: https://github.com/sparrowwallet/sparrow/issues/603Code:As of 9022438:Password field cannot be empty on encrypted wallet loadThe passphrase will not be re-requested on importing a BIP39 walletEmpty passphrases will be shown as "No Passphrase" in the seed view dialog

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: It would have been a good thing for some users because if you enter the wrong passphrase, the wallet will open with the keys of the wrong passphrase, but annoying for me because I did not requested for the extra security.Quote from: Yamane_Keto on November 20, 2023, 04:54:38 AMAre you using the latest version of Sparrow wallet? It was reported as a bug and appears to have been resolved here https://github.com/sparrowwallet/sparrow/commit/902243839749d1693eb93b3a1161f41d37d354a0I have just downloaded the wallet yesterday and the it is the current version which is 1.8.0.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Sparrow Wallet only asks for a passphrase twice once you've done that it should not ask again for the passphrase.Quote from: _act_ on November 20, 2023, 08:28:12 AMIt would have been a good thing for some users because if you enter the wrong passphrase, the wallet will open with the keys of the wrong passphrase, but annoying for me because I did not requested for the extra security.If you didn't add this passphrase you might accidentally add a passphrase during importing/generating the BIP39 seed on Sparrow take note that space(whitespaces) is considered a character and you might accidentally tap the space bar on your keyboard.If I'm right then you can re-import your seed backup and leave the passphrase empty make sure no extra spaces on that box and then just add a password after you apply.

comments.author: satscraper
comments.body: @OP, when creating your wallet you might accidentally checked "Use passphrase" box and entered password to harden you SEED phrase as well as encrypted you wallet with password. Thus if don't like to enter password twice restore wallet with your SEED and choose one of the two  opts- either use password to  encrypt wallet or use it to harden SEED phrase.
